result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Merl Fredrick

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:12 AM Defendant Lawrence Merl Fredrick in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Lawrence Merl Fredrick.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Lawrence Merl Fredrick
Current: 514 E 5th St Apt # 3, Superior, WI 54880 United States  (Effective: 09-19-2022)
Prior: 1420 N 12Th St, Superior, WI 54880
No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of alcohol.

3:32 PM Defendant Lawrence Merl Fredrick in court.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Address updated as 514 East 5th Street, Apt 3, Superior. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. Defendant pleads not guilty.  Court accepts plea. Court addresses citations. State indicates 22TR2871 will be dismissed. Defendant pleads guilty on the remaining citations, Court accepts pleas, orders fines on citations, 120 days to pay. 
State indicates $1,787 posted already. Asking for $3500 cash bond. No driving, no alcohol. Cites priors.
Defendant has no ability to post any more bail.
Court orders $1787 already posted. Conditions of no driving without valid permit or license, no use or possession of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
